title: 2. Datatypes
content:
## Notes

- Use snake_case for variables
- Datatypes cannot be mixed, they need to be typecasted
- String decimal points need to be typecasted twice to be converted to integer*

### Datatypes

```python
# Integer Data Type
failed_subjects = 2
# Float Data Type
grade_average = 2.3
# String Data type
name = 'John'
# Boolean Data Type
is_valid = True
is_invalid = False
```

### Printing Datatypes

```python
print(type(failed_subjects))
print(type(grade_average))
print(type(name))
print(type(is_valid))
print(type(is_invalid))

# Prints the following
#<class 'int'>
#<class 'float'>
#<class 'str'>
#<class 'bool'>
#<class 'bool'>
```

### TypeCasting

We typecast using a function of its correct type

```python
print(str(failed_subjects))
print(int(string_number))
a = int(1)        # a will be 1
b = int(2.5)      # b will be 2
c = int("3")      # c will be 3
c1 = int(float("3.4"))   # c1 will be... 3 (*)
d = float(1)      # d will be 1.0
e = float(2.5)    # e will be 2.5
f = float("3")    # f will be 3.0
g = float("4.23") # g will be 4.23
h = str("80s")    # h will be '80s'
i = str(22)       # i will be '22'
j = str(3.01)     # j will be '3.01'
```
